an4.168:4.1: Then Venerable Mahāmoggallāna went up to Venerable Sāriputta,
an4.168:4.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Mahāmoggallāna sat down to one side,
an4.168:5.1: “Reverend Sāriputta, there are four ways of practice.
an4.168:5.3: ~Painful practice with slow insight, ~painful practice with swift insight, ~pleasant practice with slow insight, and ~pleasant practice with swift insight.
an4.168:5.4: These are the four ways of practice.
an4.168:5.5: Which one of these four ways of practice did you rely on to free your mind from defilements without grasping?”
an4.168:6.5: I relied on the pleasant practice with swift insight to free my mind from defilements without grasping.”
